intro: Hedyotis alsinifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features opposite, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Hedyotis alsinifolia is often found in temperate regions of Asia and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
